intro: Cheiranthus hieraciifolius, commonly known as the hairy throatwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from white to pale purple. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually lance-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often growing in rocky or calcareous soils. Cheiranthus hieraciifolius is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
